info.title: Nyala Customer API

get.summary: Getting a list of customers from institution.

post.summary: Creates a new customer inside the institution.

get.summary: Searches for a customer by firstname lastname or email.

post.summary: Saving KYC data for custodying customer wallets.
Allows users to request funding for retail and issuer wallets.

requestBody.description: List of issuer and retail wallet ids.

get.summary: Returns a list of issuer wallet objects associated with the institution.

post.summary:
Generates a 24-word mnemonic seed for the institution, encrypts it with the given credentials.
Issuer wallet seed id will be returned.

put.summary:
Derives a new private key from the 24-word mnemonic seed for the institution.
Returns the id for the newly derived issuer wallet.

post.summary: Initiates recovery process in which the custodian delivers the passphrase to the institution in a secure way.

get.summary: Returns a list of issuer wallet derived from the given seed, includes the tokenized assets issued by the wallet.

post.summary: Initialize tokenized asset creation.

get.summary: Returns details about the given tokenized asset. Details include transfers, open opt-in requests and.

post.summary:
Send tokenized assets to retail wallets.
Returns a list of transfer ids.

Send fungible tokenized assets to retail wallets.
Returns a list of transfer ids.
Permanently locks issuer wallet ( won't be able to create new tokens anymore).
Approve opt-in for retail wallet.
Revokes opt-in as a result tokenized assets in the retail wallet will be frozen, if called after delivery.
Clawback asset from an account.
Burn x amount of tokens.
Build .toml file for token.

get.summary: Returns a list of retail wallet object associated with the given customer id.

post.summary:
Generates a 24-word mnemonic seed for the customer encrypts it with the given credentials.
A list of retail wallet objects are being returned, which can be derived from the seed.

requestBody.description: Contains Credentials to access the mnemonic seed. Encryption key file can be left empty, if it's stored on the Custodian side.

put.summary: Derives a new type of wallet for a customer, if the customer already has wallets.

requestBody.description: Credentials to access the mnemonic seed. Encryption key file can be left empty, if it's stored on the Custodian side.

post.summary: Request to hold a certain tokenized asset in given retail wallet.
Request to hold a certain tokenized asset in customer retail wallet.

patch.summary: Request to hold a certain tokenized asset in customer retail wallet.

post.summary: Request to hold a certain tokenized asset in given external retail wallet.

put.summary: Freezes or unfreezes all customer retail wallets by locking access to the mnemonic seed.

post.summary: Checks if the passphrase is correct for the given customer retail wallet.
Initiates retail wallet passphrase recovery.

Generates and returns a PDF file containing the 24-word mnemonic seed for retail wallets.
Removes retail wallet seed from the custodian database.

requestBody.description: Credentials to access the mnemonic seed. Encryption key file can be left empty, if it's stored on the Custodian side.

post.summary: Create a request for tokenized asset transfer to another wallet.

requestBody.description: Contains information for the transfer including amount, recipient address and credentials. Credentials to access the mnemonic seed. Encryption key file can be left empty, if it's stored on the Custodian side.

post.summary: Import external wallets into the system.

requestBody.description: External wallets' public addresse with some metadata.

get.summary: Returns the Users identity, if HMAC authentication worked.

TanganyCustomerKycDocumentDto.description: The document which was used for verification. Note that a document is required for all verification methods except for in_person

nationality.description: Stated nationality. Must be a ISO 3166-1 Alpha-2 country code. Additionally "XX" is allowed for unknown states.

country.description: Document issuing country. Must be a ISO 3166-1 Alpha-2 country code. Additionally "XX" is allowed for unknown states. Nullable only for QES_bankident method - has to be set to null or removed from the object

number.description: ID of the document. Nullable only for eID and QES_bankident methods - has to be set to null or removed from the object

issuedBy.description: Name of the document issuer. Nullable only for eID and QES_bankident methods - has to be set to null or removed from the object

issueDate.description: Date of issuance in the format YYYY-MM-DD. Must be >= 1900-01-01. If not provided, can be set to n/a. Nullable only for QES_bankident method - has to be set to null or removed from the object

validUntil.description: Stated expiration date of the document in the YYYY-MM-DD format. Must be >= 1900-01-01. Nullable only for QES_bankident method - has to be set to null or removed from the object

iban.description: International Bank Account Number comprised of 34 characters, letters and numbers. Nullable for all methods except QES_bankident

reference.description: Reference or purpose of a transfer containing any characters. Nullable for all methods except QES_bankident

TanganyDocumentType.description: Type of the document. Nullable only for QES_bankident method - has to be set to null or removed from the object

tags.name: Customer
tags.description: The first step in the tokenization lifecycle is to create a Customer that will receive the token.

tags.name: Retail Wallet
tags.description: The second step in the tokenization lifecycle is to request a retail wallet for the Customer newly created. The tokens will be sent to that wallet, and the private key to the wallet will be custodied using our technology.
